name: elmapfn
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wfn(c0, c2))

stmt.origin: ffnd(c0, c2, c1, wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wfn(c0, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(c0, c2, c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wfn(c0, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(c0, c2, c1))

body.origin: |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(c0, c2, c1))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, c2)), wfn(c0, c2))

comment: A mapping is a function with the appropriate domain. (Contributed by AV, 6-Apr-2019.)
